title: The Fetch-Decode-Execute Cycle
description: A quick, practical guide to The Fetch-Decode-Execute Cycle.

hook.text: Your CPU repeats the same three steps billions of times per second: fetch, decode, execute.

buildup.text: Fetch grabs the next instruction from memory. Decode figures out what it means.

discovery.text: Execute carries out the instruction â€” an addition, a comparison, a memory write.

twist.text: Modern CPUs overlap these steps. While one instruction executes, the next is already being fetched.

climax.text: This pipelining lets a 3 GHz chip effectively process far more than 3 billion instructions per second.

punchline.text: Fetch, decode, execute â€” forever, billions of times.
